item.title: Daily Podcast 2026-02-28
item.description: BioStruct-Africa is tackling a critical gap in global structural biology: the lack of infrastructure, training, and sustained mentorship for African scientists to fully leverage tools like AlphaFold. | The framework is designed to be scalable and sustainable. | Geographically, participants came primarily from Eastern Africa (30% from Kenya, the host country), with significant representation from West Africa (15% Nigeria, 10% Cameroon) and smaller numbers from Southern and Northern Africa.
item.itunes:author: Eva Dai
item.itunes:summary: BioStruct-Africa is tackling a critical gap in global structural biology: the lack of infrastructure, training, and sustained mentorship for African scientists to fully leverage tools like AlphaFold. | The framework is designed to be scalable and sustainable. | Geographically, participants came primarily from Eastern Africa (30% from Kenya, the host country), with significant representation from West Africa (15% Nigeria, 10% Cameroon) and smaller numbers from Southern and Northern Africa.
